item.title: Melbourne is getting crowded
item.description: ## OGR data source with driver: ESRI Shapefile ## Source: "C:\Users\09492659\Documents\GitHub\visualising_pedestrian_counts\data", layer: "geo_export_d0200aa4-a69f-4865-98de-4a1a13c7072e" ## with 20861 features ## It has 5 fields How many sensors do we have? Where are the sensors? ## long lat order hole piece id group ## 1 144.9740 -37.81631 1 FALSE 1 0 0.1 ## 2 144.9741 -37.81625 2 FALSE 1 0 0.1 ## 3 144.9741 -37.81620 3 FALSE 1 0 0.1 ## 4 144.

item.title: Visualisation
item.description: When I was young, I didn’t give a shi* about presentation. I recall a school project, where the evaluation matrix specifically said presentation would make up 50% of the score. I think I only presented numbers and text. And gave up 50% of the score. Fast forward 20 years, and I’m now wiser to a truth that I had no inkling of as a child: humans are visual animals.

item.title: Origins
item.description: It’s hot today. It’s 36 degrees celcius, and in the southern-Australian summer, outdoors feels like the moment when you open the oven, and a burst of hot, dry air rushes towards your face. Only the heat doesn’t go away, instead of the smell of food is replaced by the smell of bushfires. The high UV index also means staying indoor is the most sensible thing to do. So here I am, writing my first post on this blog.
